StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [sp_dbaCreateDummyDODCodeFinal]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@NewDODCode varchar(20) OUTPUT AS
--============================================================================= -- -- Insert new high school with NO DOD_CODE -- --=============================================================================
declare @size int declare @max_dod_code varchar(9) declare @max_int int
set @max_dod_code=( select max(dod_code) from high_school where len(dod_code)=9 and isnumeric(dod_code)=1 and dod_code like '00%' ) --print @max_dod_code
set @max_int =( select convert(int,@max_dod_code) + 1 )
set @size=len(convert(int,@max_dod_code) + 1) --print @size
IF (@size=4) BEGIN -- print @size set @max_dod_code='00000'+convert(varchar(4),@max_int) set @NewDODCode=@max_dod_code print @max_dod_code
END
IF (@size=5) BEGIN -- print @size set @max_dod_code='0000'+convert(varchar(5),@max_int) set @NewDODCode=@max_dod_code print @max_dod_code
END
IF (@size=6) BEGIN -- print @size set @max_dod_code='000'+convert(varchar(6),@max_int) set @NewDODCode=@max_dod_code print @max_dod_code
END
IF (@size=7) BEGIN -- print @size set @max_dod_code='00'+convert(varchar(7),@max_int) set @NewDODCode=@max_dod_code print @max_dod_code
END
IF (@size=8) BEGIN -- print @size set @max_dod_code='0'+convert(varchar(8),@max_int) set @NewDODCode=@max_dod_code print @max_dod_code
END
IF (@size=9) BEGIN -- print @size set @max_dod_code=convert(varchar(9),@max_int) set @NewDODCode=@max_dod_code print @max_dod_code
END
IF (@size>9) BEGIN print 'The maximum dod code size is 9 digits. Please add school manually!' END
--============================================================================================
